e4: The current policy is ethically questionable and exposes ABC to legal liability. While a shift to unbiased reporting could cause short-term market disruption, transparency and adherence to ethical financial practices are crucial for long-term sustainability and investor trust. Communicating the change clearly and addressing potential investor concerns will minimize negative impacts.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and completeness. It avoids any intentional manipulation or obfuscation of financial information, ensuring that all stakeholders have access to a fair and unbiased representation of the company's performance. This includes clearly communicating any changes in accounting practices and proactively addressing potential investor questions or concerns about those changes.
e6: Yes, I would have several follow-up questions for the management team. 1) How do we plan to communicate the policy change transparently to all investors, both sophisticated and retail? 2) What mitigation strategies can be put in place to minimize short-term market volatility following the announcement? 3) Have we consulted with legal counsel regarding the potential liabilities under the current reporting practice and how a change would affect those liabilities?
